website_summaries.verdict: If you don't mind the small keyboard and can get past the cringe-inducing name, T-Mobile's Samsung Smiley is an easy-to-use messaging phone.
pros: The Samsung Smiley has a functional midrange feature set and respectable call quality
cons: The Samsung Smiley's keyboard is a tad cramped and offers few shortcut keys
Some messaging options require use of the Web browser

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT for OLD SCHOOL HUSBAND
customer_reviews.text: My man will not switch to a Smart Phone. The seller advertised as very good, and the condition was excellent. Very happy hubby!

customer_reviews.title: Good service, great shipping
customer_reviews.text: Phone received promptly many days before it was scheduled to arrive, together with a nice handwritten note. Also, unlike the last phone I ordered through Amazon, this one came with a sim card. Had I started to use the phone, the rating would be a five.
customer_reviews.author: Allen W. Wood

customer_reviews.title: Great Phone! *before it inevitably dies*
customer_reviews.text: The Samsung Smile is a great phone. Love the interaction, clear calling, qwerty pad, slide function, display, camera, etc. However, I have owned 3 of these bad boys and ALL 3 (the last one decided to malfunction this past week) start to malfunction and/or die within a years time. Must be a chip implanted on the circuit board that has a 'self-destruct' mode built in. When they DID work - they are the best! Great phones. Reasonably prices and look nice. After a year: zippo.
customer_reviews.author: Screamsnthings

customer_reviews.title: Died after a year
customer_reviews.text: I really miss the days when phones could last for more than a year or so. I had a Samsung phone that lasted over 3 years back in the day. I bought this one in May 2011, and it stopped working today (Sept. 2012). It's quite frustrating that most people upgrade their phones every year or so, and the manufacturers no longer seem to build things to last. I really don't want a phone that is also a GPS, music player, web surfing device, game console, dog trainer, etc. I just want a phone that can make phone calls and last for more than a year or so. This is not that phone.
customer_reviews.author: D. Auyeung

customer_reviews.title: Screen went blank
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because of the reviews. It lasted just 6 months. The screen went blank and I had to buy a new one you maybe sorry
customer_reviews.author: AL pat

customer_reviews.title: awsome
customer_reviews.text: I love my Samsung Smiley. It works great and i love that you dont have to flip the phone to us the keyborad. All you have to do is slide it up and that is why i love the Samsung Smiley.
customer_reviews.author: Vey cheaply made

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PHONE... Definitely could be cheaper...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this phone for about a year... It's a great little phone, the qwerty keyboard is nice and responsive. And me and my sister have had the same phone (Her's being a little over a year and mine being a little under) I happened to break my phone when I was skateboarding and crashed reeeeaaally hard. Over than that! This phone is great although I think it's a bit expensive for the phone.

customer_reviews.title: I really like this phone
customer_reviews.text: I really like this phone. I wish they still made them. It is a simple phone for calling and texting. It can take photos, too (not great ones).

customer_reviews.title: Good while it lasts
customer_reviews.text: Died after 6 months. Started vibrating and then just stopped working. I liked everything about it until that point but what good it that? Not a good thing after you buy the phone,case and charger. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Janice A. Stone

product_meta.title: Samsung : Smiley T359 Unlocked GSM Slider Phone with Full QWERTY Keyboard, 1.3MP Camera, GPS, Bluetooth and microSD Slot - Black/Blue
product_meta.description: The Samsung :) weighs 4 ounces and measures 3.9 x 2.3 x 0.6 inches. Its 1000 mAh lithium-ion battery is rated at up to 6 hours of talk time, and up to 456 hours (19 days) of standby time. It runs on the 850/900/1800/1900 MHz GSM/GPRS/EDGE frequencies, as well as T-Mobile's 3G network (1700/2100 MHz).
feature_bullets: This unlocked cell phone is compatible with GSM carriers like AT&T and T-Mobile. Not all carrier features may be supported. It will not work with CDMA carriers like Verizon Wireless, Alltel and Sprint
3G-enabled quick messaging phone with slide-up vertical QWERTY keyboard and dedicated shortcuts to messaging and social networks
Compatible with T-Mobile's 3G network for fast downloads as well as quick uploads of photo and video to sharing sites
1.3-megapixel camera/camcorder; Bluetooth stereo music; microSD memory expansion to 16 GB; organizer tools; personal and work e-mail
Up to 6 hours of talk time, up to 456 hours (19 days) of standby time; released in July, 2010

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.6 out of 5 stars50 ratings3.6 out of 5 stars
